name: isArray

returnValue.description: either true or false whether the value is an array or not

examples: import { isArray } from "@commonly/reflect"isArray([])     //-> trueisArray({})      //-> false
description: Check if a given value is an {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/array | array}.

name: isBoolean

returnValue.description: either true or false whether the value is a boolean or not

examples: import { isBoolean } from "@commonly/reflect"isBoolean(true)     //-> trueisBoolean(false)    //-> trueisBoolean(NaN)      //-> false
description: Check if a given value is a {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/boolean | boolean}.

name: isError

returnValue.description: either true or false whether the value is an Error or not

examples: import { isError } from "@commonly/reflect"isError(new Error())    //-> trueisError(TypeError())    //-> trueisError(NaN)            //-> false
description: Check if a given value is an {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Error | Error}.

name: isFunction

returnValue.description: either true or false whether the value is a function or not

examples: import { isFunction } from "@commonly/reflect"isFunction(Math.add)        //-> trueisFunction(() => void 0))   //-> trueisFunction(Math.PI)         //-> false
description: Check if a given value is a {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/function | function}.

name: isMap

returnValue.description: either true or false whether the value is a Map or not

examples: import { isMap } from "@commonly/reflect"isMap(new Map())     //-> trueisMap(NaN)           //-> false
description: Check if a given value is a {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map | Map}.

name: isNil

returnValue.description: either true or false whether the value is a Nil or not

examples: import { isNil } from "@commonly/reflect"isNil(undefined)   //-> trueisNil(null)        //-> trueisNil(NaN)         //-> false
description: Check if a given value is a {@link @commonly/type:Nil | Nil} (either an undefined or a null).

name: isNull

returnValue.description: either true or false whether the value is a null or not

examples: import { isNull } from "@commonly/reflect"isNull(null)        //-> trueisNull(undefined)   //-> false
description: Check if a given value is a {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/null | null}.

name: isNumber

returnValue.description: either true or false whether the value is a number or not

examples: import { isNumber } from "@commonly/reflect"isNumber(0)           //-> trueisNumber(NaN)         //-> trueisNumber(null)        //-> false
description: Check if a given value is a {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/number | number}.

name: isObject

returnValue.description: either true or false whether the value is an Object or not

examples: import { isObject } from "@commonly/reflect"isObject(new Object())      //-> trueisObject({})                //-> trueisObject(null)              //-> falseisObject(undefined)         //-> false
description: Check if a given value is an {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object | Object}.

name: isPrimitive
remarks: Both can classify as a primitive, the primitive value and a primitive wrapper object.

returnValue.description: either true or false whether the value is a Primitive or not

examples: import { isPrimitive } from "@commonly/reflect"isPrimitive(undefined)   //-> trueisPrimitive(null)        //-> trueisPrimitive(NaN)         //-> trueisPrimitive([])          //-> false
description: Check if a given value is a {@link @commonly/type:Primitive | Primitive}.

name: isPromise

returnValue.description: either true or false whether the value is a Promise or not

examples: import { isPromise } from "@commonly/reflect"isPromise(new Promise())         //-> trueisPromise(Promise.resolve())     //-> trueisPromise(NaN)                   //-> false
description: Check if a given value is a {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise | Promise}.

name: isRegExp

returnValue.description: either true or false whether the value is a RegExp or not

examples: import { isRegExp } from "@commonly/reflect"isRegExp(new RegExp("ab+c"))        //-> trueisRegExp(/ab+c/)                    //-> trueisRegExp(NaN)                       //-> false
description: Check if a given value is a {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/RegExp | RegExp}.

name: isSet

returnValue.description: either true or false whether the value is a Set or not

examples: import { isSet } from "@commonly/reflect"isSet(new Set())     //-> trueisSet(NaN)           //-> false
description: Check if a given value is a {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Set | Set}.

name: isString

returnValue.description: either true or false whether the value is a string or not

examples: import { isString } from "@commonly/reflect"isString("string")   //-> trueisString(null)       //-> false
description: Check if a given value is a {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/string | string}.

name: isSymbol

returnValue.description: either true or false whether the value is a symbol or not

examples: import { isSymbol } from "@commonly/reflect"isSymbol(Symbol())      //-> trueisSymbol(NaN)           //-> false
description: Check if a given value is a {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/symbol | symbol}.

name: isUndefined

returnValue.description: either true or false whether the value is an undefined or not

examples: import { isUndefined } from "@commonly/reflect"isUndefined(undefined)   //-> trueisUndefined(null)        //-> false
description: Check if a given value is an {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/undefined | undefined}.
